page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY 1
page.content: {Bradley Manor}is an historical building which is open on Wednesdays from Easter to October.It was built in the{13th century,}and a new house was joined to this part in the{15th {century,}built by{Richard Yarde. Bradley Manor now belongs to the{ {National Trust,}but the Woolner family who live there are descended from the Yarde family.The Manor House is set in 70 acres of woodland and meadow, with the River Lemon running close by. The woods are open to the public and the peaceful walks are enjoyed by the people of Newton Abbot as well as tourists. {Castle Dyke}is a house in{Highweek} village.To the north east of the house is a mound which is the remains of a wooden{Norman motte and bailey castle} The village of Teignwick grew up around the castle until its demise.
